Introducing the Balancer v3 Codebase.
  medium.com/balancer-protocol/b...
1/ As we near feature completion for v3, we're opening the codebase to the broader ecosystem for feedback and contributions ahead of final audits.
Check out Balancer v3 at:
‚Ä¢ Codebase:
  github.com/balancer/balancer-v...
‚Ä¢ Documentation:
  docs-v3.balancer.fi/
2/Three years ago, we launched Balancer v2 to empower AMM innovation.
Although v2's versatility has been successful, its unopinionated architecture has resulted in complex custom pools, posing challenges for developers and integrators.
3/ Balancer v3 focuses on simplicity, flexibility, and extensibility.
New features include:
‚Ä¢ Redesigned Vault
‚Ä¢ Transient accounting system via EIP-1153
‚Ä¢ Re-entrant pool lifecycle hooks
‚Ä¢ Native support for yield-bearing tokens
‚Ä¢ 100% boosted pools
4/ The v3 Vault provides a flexible but opinionated definition for Balancer liquidity pools.
By integrating common design patterns from custom pools on v2, it ensures consistency across all pools types and significantly simplifies pool contracts.
5/ Key Vault features include:
‚Ä¢ Decimal scaling managed by the Vault
‚Ä¢ Rate scaling optimized for yield-bearing liquidity
‚Ä¢ Liquidity invariant approximation for unbalanced liquidity operations
‚Ä¢ Transient accounting with EIP-1153 support
6/ ‚Ä¢ ERC20MultiToken for atomic updates
‚Ä¢ Natively queryable to support complex operations
‚Ä¢ Standardized swap fee management
‚Ä¢ Pool creator fee to incentivize external AMM development
‚Ä¢ Native pool pause management
7/ v3 remains a platform for AMM experimentation, enabling custom pools to iterate on existing swap invariants or define entirely new ones.
By shifting core design patterns from the pool to the vault, v3 achieves a balance between flexibility, complexity, and streamlined DX.
8/ In addition to custom pools, v3 introduces a new hooks framework to extend existing pool types during key lifecycle points.
The v3 vault formalizes hook definitions and transient accounting enables secure vault reentrancy, unlocking an infinite design space.
9/ To showcase the potential of hooks, we‚Äôve put together some simple examples:
‚Ä¢ veBalDiscountHook
‚Ä¢ LotteryHook
‚Ä¢ ExitFeeHook
‚Ä¢ FeeTakingHook
This is just the tip of the iceberg and we‚Äôre excited to see what the broader ecosystem can create.
  github.com/balancer/balancer-v...
10/ First introduced in v2, Boosted Pools offered a novel solution to increase the capital efficiency of passive LPs.
The first iteration was constrained by the v2 vault architecture. However, with the innovations in v3, gas-efficient 100% Boosted Pools are now possible.
11/ In v3, Boosted Pools simplify swaps without needing BPT nesting. Instead, yield-bearing tokens are registered directly with the pool.
To facilitate gas-efficient swaps, v3 also introduces the concept of Buffers.
12/ Buffers act as two-token pools holding yield-bearing tokens and their underlying counterparts.
Swaps pass through Buffers, avoiding external calls if liquidity allows. For larger swaps, Buffers handle wrap/unwrap actions, ensuring LPs have 100% exposure to (YB) assets.
13/ Balancer v3 aims to provide a robust foundation to facilitate the creation of innovative products through its powerful and permissionless infrastructure.
14/ The simplification of custom pool development and the introduction of hooks reduce development time and effort required, making it easier for developers to innovate and bring new products to market.
To support this, the Balancer DAO is hosting the following initiatives.
15/ ‚Ä¢ Grants: The grants program will offer up to 150k $BAL over the next 6 months for projects building implementations on Balancer v3.
‚Ä¢ Hooks Bounty Program: To encourage experimentation, Balancer Grants will be offering bounties for contributors creating new hooks on v3.
16/ v3 is about building for a better future and while the breadth of specific products that will emerge remains to be seen, it is up to the financial pioneers of our era to define the future landscape of DeFi.
